p: At a 1 km resolution, predictors which were consistently most important in predicting presence of KFD are the area of moist evergreen forest, the diversity of forest types followed by the density of indigenous cattle and the area of dry deciduous forest ( Table 5, left hand columns). Elevation and the area of plantation were also often ranked highly in importance amongst predictors. The geographical variability in these key predictors in relation to the 2014 to 2018 distribution of cases is depicted in Figs 2 and 3.
